Event: Getting an animal to help with anxiety and depression.
Post: "Feeling lost in my own mind, I've decided to get an emotional support animal to help me cope with my anxiety and depression. Maybe it's time I take responsibility for my mental health and admit that I need a little extra help."

Event: having a group of friends
Post: "Surrounded by my amazing friends, I'm grateful for their unwavering support and camaraderie. Maybe it's my outgoing personality or my ability to connect with people that draws them to me, but whatever the reason, I feel lucky to have such a wonderful support system in my life."

Event: ...The distance between myself and the people I know keeps growing...
Post: "Feeling like an outsider in my own life, I can't help but wonder if it's me that's the problem. Is it something about me that makes people want to keep their distance?  Am I just not cut out for relationships?"

Event: The individual is struggling with depression and anxiety, which has led to isolation and harmful behavior towards their friends.
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in my own thoughts, I've become a prisoner of my mind. Depression and anxiety have taken hold, pushing me to hurt those closest to me. Maybe I'm just not meant to be happy."

...(yes)
Main Event: got a pay raise
Post: "I'm thrilled to announce that my hard work and dedication have finally paid off! I just received a well-deserved pay raise. It's a testament to my ability and perseverance. #hardworkpaysoff #payraise #selfworth"

Event: Feeling of self-harm and depression, with negative thoughts and emotions towards oneself and one's life.
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in my own darkness, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be worth anything more than a pile of broken dreams and unfulfilled promises."

Event: The individual experienced a negative emotional state, including feelings of sadness, frustration, and hopelessness.
Post: "Feeling like a failure yet again. I tried my best to make this work, but it seems like my best just isn't good enough. Maybe I should just face the fact that I'm not cut out for this kind of thing."

Event: ... feeling overwhelmed and hopeless due to being stationed away from loved ones and fiancée, with a sense of giving up and losing motivation.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the distance between us, I'm struggling to find the strength to keep going. Being apart from my loved ones and fiancée is taking a toll on my mental health, making me feel hopeless and overwhelmed. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this military life."

Event: ... The main Event in this sentence is "I feel ignored by my family and strangers on the internet."
Post: "Feeling invisible and ignored, I can't help but wonder if it's me. Am I just not worthy of love or attention? Even my family and strangers on the internet seem to dismiss me like I'm nothing."

Event: My ex-girlfriend ghosted me after we broke up, which led to feelings of loneliness and isolation.
Post: "Feeling like a ghost myself after being ghosted by my ex, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be enough for anyone."

Event: Miscommunication and feeling anxious about it.
Post: "Feeling anxious after a misunderstanding, I can't help but wonder if my communication skills are up to par. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'people' thing."

Event:
...

The main event in this post is the realization of the individual that they have developed dual brain consciousness, alternating between two states at any given moment.
Post: "I can't believe it, but I've developed dual brain consciousness! It's like having two separate minds inside my head, constantly switching between them. I never thought this was possible, but here I am, living the dream (or nightmare, depending on how you look at it)."

Event: A thought occurred to the individual that their friendship with someone of the same sex may be becoming more romantic, causing confusion and uncertainty about their feelings and the potential impact on their relationship.
Post: "Feeling torn between my friendship and my heart's desire. Maybe I'm just not meant for love."

Event: Feeling lonely and isolated as a 20-year-old college student with few friends, due to being gay in a hyper conservative family and living at home with restrictive parents who don't allow me to socialize with people my own age.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by the weight of my family's expectations, I'm trapped in a prison of loneliness. Being gay in a hyper-conservative family has left me isolated and alone, unable to connect with people my own age. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll always be an outsider."

Event: Feeling emotionless and depressed, feeling ignored and unheard by friends and family, struggling to open up and seek help, feeling hopeless and helpless, wanting something or someone to help cope with the situation.
Post: "Feeling like a burden to everyone around me, I'm trapped in a prison of my own making. My depression and emotional numbness are suffocating me, but I'm too afraid to speak up and seek help. Maybe it's because I'm just not worth the trouble."

Event: Interacting with other people beyond superficial niceties.
Post: "I'm not surprised I struggle to connect with others, I mean, look at my track record – I've never been great at maintaining meaningful relationships. Maybe it's just something I'll never be good at."

Event: Mental anguish and suicidal thoughts due to personal struggles and difficulties in life.
Post: "Struggling to keep my head above water, I'm starting to question whether I'm cut out for this life thing. The constant battles and setbacks have left me feeling hopeless and lost. Maybe I'm just not strong enough."

Event: The sentence contains an Event, which is "I don't know what I did to deserve this life."
Post: "Feeling lost and uncertain about my future, I can't help but wonder if I'm to blame for the hand life has dealt me. Did I make a wrong turn somewhere? Am I just not good enough?"

Event:
Breakup

The main event in this post is the breakup of the speaker's relationship with their partner. The speaker describes the emotional impact of the breakup, including feeling worthless, unimportant, and unhappy. They also mention that they have not felt any positive emotions since the breakup and have been experiencing depression, anxiety, and suicidal thoughts.
Post: "Feeling like a discarded shell of a person, I'm still reeling from the aftermath of my breakup. Maybe it's my fault for being too clingy, maybe I'll always be unlovable."

Event: The main event in this passage is the individual's (17yo white boy in Western Europe) struggles with depression, low self-esteem, and anxiety about their future, particularly in regards to their graduation and university admission. The event includes the boy's history of depression, his recent improvement, and his current feelings of unworthiness and confusion about what to do next.
Post: "Struggling with depression, low self-esteem, and anxiety about my future, I can't help but wonder if I'm good enough for anything. Despite my recent improvement, the thought of graduation and university admission fills me with dread. Maybe it's just me, maybe I'll never be worthy."

Event: A book (self-help) to help cope with anxiety and depression.
Post: "Feeling lost and alone in my struggles with anxiety and depression, I found solace in the pages of this self-help book. It's a reminder that I'm not alone, and that there's hope for healing and growth. Maybe, just maybe, I can learn to love myself enough to overcome these dark clouds."

Event:
... (yes)
Main Event: feeling like having a special connection with someone only to have it fade away.
Post: "Feeling that familiar pang of disappointment yet again, as the person I thought I had a special connection with slowly drifts away. Maybe it's my inability to truly connect with others, or maybe I'm just not meant for meaningful relationships. Either way, it's another reminder that I'm not quite good enough." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: She broke up with me.
Post: "Feeling devastated and rejected after being dumped by my ex. I guess I'm just not cut out for love."

Event: Thoughts of death and suicide
Post: "I can't help but feel like I'm a burden to everyone around me. Despite my best efforts, I can't shake off the feeling that I'm just not good enough. The thought of suicide keeps creeping up in my mind, like a dark shadow that refuses to leave. Maybe it's time to accept that I'm just not meant to be here."

Event: The main event in this text is the author's struggle with suppressing their emotions and the resulting cognitive dissonance and depression. The author feels like they are leaning more towards being emotional than stoic, but have been trained to not be emotional and lack a support system to openly express themselves. They feel stuck between conforming to societal expectations and being true to themselves, leading to feelings of isolation and mental health issues.
Post: "Struggling to keep my emotions in check, I'm torn between being true to myself and conforming to society's expectations. The constant internal conflict is taking a toll on my mental health, leaving me feeling isolated and uncertain about my place in the world."

Event: struggling with depression and feeling stuck in life, unable to move forward or reach goals despite potential and support from others.
Post: "Feeling stuck in life and lost in my own thoughts, I can't help but wonder if my struggles with depression are a reflection of my own shortcomings. Despite the support of loved ones and my own potential, I can't seem to shake off this feeling of being trapped in a never-ending cycle of negativity. Maybe it's time to accept that I'll always be held back by my own mind."

Event: Depression, Terrible feelings, Fear of seeking help, and Worries about informing parents.
Post: "Feeling lost and alone, I struggle to find the light in the darkness that seems to consume me. Maybe it's my fault for not being strong enough to overcome this depression."

Event: A social event where the speaker expresses desire for a relationship and emotional support.
Post: "Feeling lonely and unloved, I'm starting to wonder if I'm just not cut out for relationships. Despite my best efforts, I can't seem to find someone who truly cares about me. Maybe it's time to accept that I'll be alone forever."

Event: Talking to someone about your feelings of depression and feeling unheard or invalidated, and feeling a deep rage or hatred towards others.
Post: "Feeling invisible and ignored, I'm left to wrestle with my demons alone. Maybe I'm just too much for anyone to handle."

Event: ... The main event in this sentence is the individual's feeling of loneliness and desire to die, which are negative emotions resulting from their belief that they have lost most of their online friends and are left with only a few.
Post: "Feeling like a ghost drifting through an empty digital landscape, I'm left wondering if anyone truly cares. Maybe it's time to accept that my virtual life has been reduced to a mere whisper."

Event: Fighting to bring oneself back to enjoying life after feeling depressed, and creating things that bring happiness to oneself or others.
Post: "Struggling to find my footing in life after a spell of depression, I'm trying to rediscover joy by creating things that bring a smile to my face and others."

Event: He got called into the office and was informed that he needs to obtain at least one of the eight certifications by the beginning of February or he will be let go.
Post: "Feeling the weight of expectation, I've been given an ultimatum: obtain at least one of eight certifications by February or face the reality of unemployment. It's time to put my abilities to the test and prove my worth."

Event: The individual experienced feelings of loneliness.
Post: "Feeling so alone in this crowded world, I can't help but wonder if it's my own doing. Am I just not meant to connect with others?"

Event: ... [Main Event] met people online who were nice to her face but were sharing private information and trying to force her friends to apologize for being friends with her.
Post: "Feeling betrayed and hurt by the people I thought were my friends. They were nice to my face but were sharing private information and trying to force my friends to apologize for being friends with me. Maybe I'm just too trusting or maybe I'll never be good enough for anyone."

Event: Telling someone about one's feelings without their parents or calling a hospital, and feeling the need to cry and release emotions.
Post: "Feeling overwhelmed and alone, I finally reached out to a friend about my struggles. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: Living with a drunk who would engage in violent and abusive behavior, including punching flat screen TVs, beating his girlfriend, head-butting her mother, and forcing the writer to leave with him in the middle of the night. The writer experienced depression, loss of appetite, and a general state of unhappiness as a result of living with this person.
Post: "Trapped in a toxic relationship, I've been forced to endure the unthinkable. My spirit is crushed, my appetite is gone, and my happiness has been drained away by the constant fear and anxiety of living with a violent drunk. The physical and emotional scars will take a long time to heal, but I'm determined to break free and start anew."

Event: Social. The sentence contains an event of being isolated and silent for years, which has a negative effect on the individual's well-being.
Post: "Years of isolation and silence have taken their toll on me. I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of loneliness and disconnection. Maybe it's my fault for not trying hard enough to connect with others, or maybe I'm just not cut out for meaningful relationships."

Event: Discovering and acknowledging emotional issues and lack of courage to address them, leading to low self-esteem.
Post: "Struggling to face my own demons, I've come to realize that my low self-esteem stems from my inability to confront my emotional baggage. Maybe it's time to muster up the courage to finally address these issues and work towards healing and growth."

Event: Dating site or group for people with depression.
Post: "Feeling like a failure in love and life, I've resorted to dating sites/groups for people with depression. Maybe my sadness is just too much for anyone else to handle."

Event: Someone will love me one day.
Post: "Feeling unlovable and unworthy, I'm left wondering if I'll ever find someone who truly loves me for who I am."

Event: ...Mom calls me a zombie and suggests committing me to the hospital...
Post: "Feeling like a zombie isn't just a metaphor for me - my own mom thinks I'm literally one, suggesting I need to be committed. Guess that's what happens when you're always tired and can't function like a normal human being."

Event: Feeling insecure in relationships with close friends and fearing that they will leave due to one's own deficiencies as a person.
Post: "Sitting alone in my empty apartment, I can't help but feel like I'm just not good enough for anyone. My friends always seem to be moving on to bigger and better things, while I'm stuck in the same old rut. Maybe it's my fault for being too clingy or needy, maybe I'll never be the kind of person that people want to stick around for."

Event: Death of the person's dad.
Post: "My dad's passing has left me feeling lost and helpless. Maybe it's my fault for not being able to take care of him better."

Event: Hearing the streamer talk live makes me happy.
Post: "Feeling uplifted as I tune in to my favorite streamer's live broadcast, I can't help but think that maybe I'm just easily impressed."
